medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports generalized abdominal pain for a few months, worsening over the past 3 days, with possible greatest pain in the epigastric region. Symptoms include nausea and vomiting. EMS witnessed generalized tonic-clonic seizures, with an indication of some pseudoseizure activity. No fever, diarrhea reported, with complaints of cough and vague chest pain. Shortness of breath attributed to asthma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Spinal bifida, paraplegia, epilepsy, hypertension, asthma, COPD, history of VRE pyelonephritis, GERD, depression, genital herpes, atopic dermatitis, back pain, uterine prolapse.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives alone in an apartment, is mostly wheelchair bound but can transfer independently. She expresses reluctance to have strangers in her home. She has two twin boys who live with their aunt. There is a history of cocaine use, along with smoking and alcohol consumption, quantities unknown.
